Although these indices grammatici provide valuable data, most linguistic phenomena are presented as deviations from an ideal AG norm and therefore as mistakes or errors committed by the Byzantine authors. This approach gives an utterly distorting picture of the language of Byzantine literature; cf
Byzantine Literature and the Classical Past”
